header.title: Common Problems with the Shibboleth Setup

body.p: The University of Leuven has published an excellent list of basic tests to verify a correct setup: Testing a Tomcat, CAS3 and Shibboleth IdP 1.3 setup
Here's a list of typical Lenya-specific issues.

dd.p: This usually means that the Java VM can't verify your certificate.

ul.li: After updating the Java VM to a new version, don't forget to re-add your server certificate to the default Java truststore. This applies to operating system updates as well.
Lenya's LDAP configuration file ldap.properties overrides the default Java keystore location. If you use this setting, make sure to add the certificate to this keystore.

dl.dd: If you don't run the Lenya web application in the Tomcat root context, you'll have to set the emptySessionPath attribute of the connector to true. For more information, refer to the Apache Tomcat Configuration Reference.
